questions_1.question: Which of the following statements are correct about ignition exciters?
Options: Mounted on support beams at front end of compressor casing, at 12 o’clock and 2 o’clock positions.
Capacitor discharge, high-tension type exciters which require a 115 V, 400 Hz electrical power input from the aircraft electrical system.
Mounted on support beams at front end of compressor casing, at 4 o’clock and 6 o’clock positions.
Capacitor discharge, high-tension type exciters which require a 20 V, 40 Hz electrical power input from the aircraft electrical system.
questions_1.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_1.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "Mounted on support beams at front end of compressor casing, at 12 o’clock and 2 o’clock positions, Capacitor discharge, high-tension type exciters which require a 115 V, 400 Hz electrical power input from the aircraft electrical system."
